comment: Professor Sullivan is now on my short list of favorite professors.  Basically how the class works is: you read 4 books along with the class.  Each book has one pop quiz.  There are 4 papers that you have to write that he explains some what clearly that are easy if you read! (1-2 pages). He is very open to questions though.  He is very helpful!!

He's fun but be advised: if you take this guy because he will try to influence how you interpret things into his way. For instance, it was clear after taking him that he really likes Kant and hates relativism. He will make bold moral statements and then ironically discuss how it's hard to know what truth is. He also frames questions to lead you.
He's cool and kinda hot. Lectures are entertaining and fun, he does his best. But I just didnt like the subject. lots of reading and homework everyday
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Ian Sullivan is one of the best professors at KSU. He genuinely cares for all of his students, and tries his best to help everyone succeed. His lectures were interesting and thought provoking. He gives 5 pop quizzes, but gives you 3 options of what the question will be. Overall he is a great person, and I would gladly take a course from him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This professor relies heavily on a plagiarism program, if anything shows up even as just similar, he sends it in as academic misconduct.  I went into the final paper with an A, if I had gotten a 0 on the paper I could have had nothing lower than a B, he filed an Academic Misconduct charge because the program showed a 10% similarity in a 5K word
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: good professor who really just wants his students to learn. Class is easy if you do the work and read, you dont really even need to pay attention in class. No tests, only papers and like 5 reading quizes. Papers are 2 pages long.

He is one of the best lecturers I have ever had. He really makes sure that you understand the material before continuing, and as long as it shows that you made an attempt in the class, he will grade you very well. However, there is a lot of heavy reading assigned almost every class. A lot of work, but easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Ian is one of the most down to earth professors you will find. You can tell that he genuinely loves what he does and actually cares about the wellbeing of his students. There are 6 pop quizzes given throughout the semester (the questions will come from the homework questions he gives) and two two-page essays. His "final" is a paper as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Professor Sullivan has been the one teacher I've ever had that will just really allow you to understand the material and if you don't understand he'll think of new ways to tell you. It is a lecture every class but the way he lectures is so good. He is really good at teaching and I wish more teachers were like him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very knowledgeable and respectable professor. Very helpful with a great sense of humor and you can tell he's very passionate about the material. BEWARE of pop quizzes! Multiple books required, but they're all cheap/free to download online. If you don't read you'll fail. No tests. Great class discussion to accompany readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious
